column4: Is there a log file I could check to find out why my desktop came crashing down after a evolution crash ??
what do you meen by 'desktop'
well..the desktop became totally unresponsive after a few moments..
evo crashed then gnome-panel stopped responding then finally right click desktop stopped working
ah
although oddly enough xchat never budged LOL
try running top on one of the consoles
alt+ctrl+f1, login, top
i've hard rebooted long since ;-)
but yeah worth a shot next time if it happens ag ain
with any luck there is a fix in the works ( I filed a bug report )
I hardly never reboot - kernel doesn't crash with desktop
try alt+ctrl+backspace in hard cases
I even tried that ye4s
but while it worked it logged me out of x entirely without trying to restart it..so whatever happened was prettty bad LOL
I then tried : sudo reboot < but even that 'hung' on trying to stop  cupsd
so in end a hard shutdown was needed ;(
hmm strange
could you try to remote login next time
I guess I should have tried Ctrl-alt-f! but who knows if even that would have worked due to the crash
only have one other machine and thats windowsXP
that's okay - run putty, the only useful windows program :)
interesting....illl look it up thx <<
LOL only useful windows app..how true indeed LOL
